title: Morgan Wallen, Garth Brooks, Taylor Swift & More Artists With Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums Chart: FullÂ List
summary: Male solo artists dominate, though three female solo artists and two groups have also achieved the feat.
body: Morgan Wallen â€™s I’m the Problem leads Billboard ‘s Top Country Albums chart (dated Nov. 15) for the 25th consecutive week. This ups Wallen’s career tally of weeks at No. 1 to 211, allowing him to extend his lead as the artist with the most weeks at No. 1 in the chart’s 61-year history. Wallenâ€™s achievement is especially impressive because he has amassed this hefty total of weeks at No. 1 in such a short amount of time. He first topped the chart on Aug. 15, 2020. Top Country Albums originated as Hot Country Albums in the Jan. 11, 1964 issue of Billboard . Johnny Cash â€™s Ring of Fire (The Best of Johnny Cash) headed the inaugural chart. The compilation was well-timed: â€œRing of Fireâ€ had headed Hot Country Songs for seven weeks the previous summer and had crossed over to reach the top 20 on the Billboard Hot 100. The chart was named Hot Country LPâ€™s from 1968 to 1984, when vinyl LPs were king. Twenty-one artists have logged 50 or more weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums. Male solo artists dominate, as you might expect, though three female solo artists have achieved the feat, as have two groups. (One of those groups is an all-female group.) Only one Black artâ€¦

title: Brandon Lake Wins ASCAP 2025 Christian Music Songwriter of the Year: Full WinnersÂ List

body: Brandon Lake was named ASCAPâ€™s Christian music songwriter of the year on Monday (Nov. 10), while â€œPraise,â€ which he co-wrote with Pat Barrett, was named Christian music song of the year. ASCAPâ€™s winning Christian and country music writers will be honored at the ASCAP Nashville Songwriters Celebration on Monday, Nov. 17. In 2024, he was named ASCAP Christian songwriter/artist of the Year. Lakeâ€™s most-performed songs include â€œPraise,â€ â€œHard Fought Hallelujahâ€ and â€œThatâ€™s Who I Praise.â€ Lake, 35, has received five Grammys and last week received three nominations for the upcoming 68th Annual Grammy Awards. Lake has also collected 15 GMA Dove Awards and three Billboard Music Awards and is nominated for musical event of the year (with Jelly Roll ) for â€œHard Fought Hallelujahâ€ at the upcoming CMA Awards. â€œPraise,â€ the Aâ€¦

title: Pharrellâ€™s Adidas â€˜Jellyfishâ€™ Named Shoe of the Year at 2025Â FNAAs
summary: The â€œShoe Oscarsâ€ are set for December 3 at Cipriani 25 Broadway in New York City.
body: Pharrell Williams is walking away with one of the footwear worldâ€™s highest honors. The multihyphenate artist, producer, and designer will receive the Shoe of the Year award at the 2025 Footwear News Achievement Awards (FNAAs) , it was announced Monday (Nov. 10), in recognition of his bold and boundary-pushing Virginia Adistar Jellyfish collaboration with Adidas. â€œI dreamed of a shoe that felt alive, something that moved like water, that had its own rhythm, energy and glow,â€ Williams said in a statement. â€œThe Virginia Adistar Jellyfish started as a really big idea that we kept pushing, shaping, refining until it became real. I wanted it to feel fluid, futuristic, and freeâ€”not just another shoe but a living design.â€ The sneaker, which quickly became a streetwear standout this year, fuses performance-ready materials with visual design inspired by aquatic life. Its sculptural silhouette and luminous finish made it one of the most talked-about shoes in 2025 â€” and one of Adidasâ€™ most ambitious collaborative launches to date. â€œPharrellâ€™s partnership with Adidas continues to redefine what creative collaboration in footwear can look like,â€ said Michael Atmore, chief brand officer of Fairchâ€¦

title: Iâ€™ve taken a ton of sleep trackers to bed: These are my top picks for 2025
summary: Quit counting sheep and get better sleep with one of the top devices for bedtime tracking.
body: Sleep is one of the biggest keys to feeling your best and understanding your health, and Iâ€™ve tested a ton of sleep trackers to find out which actually work. From smartwatches and fitness trackers to earbuds and non-wearables, there are a lot of options offering a range of features. Here are the best sleep trackers worth your time (and money). Fitbit Charge 6: The best sleep tracker overall Iâ€™ve tested dozens of sleep trackers, and Fitbit continues to offer some of the most reliable and actionable sleep data Iâ€™ve gotten my hands on. The Fitbit Charge 6 is my top pick for tapping into that ecosystem. The band-style tracker is compact, lightweight, and comfortable enough to wear all night, which is essential for bedtime tracking. Yet, despite its small form factor, it also packs in a well-rounded user experience for all-day wear. Alongside standout sleep features, the Charge 6 supports over 20 exercise modes, offers stress tracking via EDA scans, and integrates smoothly with Googleâ€™s growing suite of apps, all on a bright, colorful AMOLED display.

title: Vince Gill To Receive CMA Willie Nelson Lifetime AchievementÂ Award
summary: Vince Gill is an 18-time CMA Award winner, and a former 12-time CMA Awards host.
body: Country Music Hall of Famer Vince Gill will add to his already considerable collection of accolades, when he is honored with the 2025 CMA Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award during the 59th annual CMA Awards, slated for Nov. 19 in Nashville and airing on ABC. This year’s CMA Awards, hosted by Lainey Wilson, will be held at Bridgestone Arena in downtown Nashville, and will broadcast on ABC beginning at 8 p.m. ET. The awards show will also stream the following day on Hulu. The CMA Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award is given to “an iconic artist who has attained the highest degree of recognition in country music,” a release from the CMA states, adding, “The award recognizes those who have achieved both national and international prominence and stature through concert performances, humanitarian efforts, philanthropy, streaming numbers, record sales, and public representation at the highest level,” as well as artists who have “positively impacted and contributed to the growth of the genre over the course of many years.” Previous recipients of the CMA Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award include Johnny Cash (2015), Alan Jackson (2â€¦

title: Prepare your Steam library: The easiest Windows emulator just hit the Play Store
summary: It's never been easier to play Windows games on Android.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR The Windows emulator GameHub is now available on the Google Play Store. It plays Windows games via emulation, cloud gaming, or local game streaming. GameHub can also connect to a Steam account for seamless downloads. The Windows emulation scene on Android has been making rapid progress in the past few years, but it wasnâ€™t until recently that it truly became approachable. GameHub, a new app from the controller company GameSir, streamlines the Windows emulation experience in a way that anyone can understand, and itâ€™s now available on the Google Play Store starting today . GameHub, which launched earlier this year as GameFusion, is an all-in-one application that allows you to play PC games on your Android device. It can connect to Xbox Cloud Gaming directly from the app, launch local streaming apps like Steam Link, or, most importantly, play Windows games via emulation.

title: Samsung just dropped trainer-led workouts into your phone
summary: Your Galaxy Watch has also learned new workout tricks, courtesy of iFIT.
body: TL;DR Samsung has partnered with iFIT to bring expert-guided workout videos directly into Samsung Health across seven training categories. All Samsung Health users will receive one free video per category each month, with full access available for $9.99/month or $99.99/year. Galaxy Watch users can track their heart rate, calories, and duration in real-time, and some Galaxy devices include up to six months of iFIT free. Samsung Health is getting a serious upgrade. The company is introducing a new partnership with iFIT that brings a library of premium, trainer-led workouts directly into the Samsung Health app. Instead of juggling multiple fitness apps, Galaxy users can now browse guided sessions in the same place they already track their daily steps, sleep, and exercises. It follows Samsung Healthâ€™s recent upgrade that added smarter wellness insights and body-tracking tools, making the app feel more like a true fitness hub. This matters because iFIT is known for high-quality, studio-style workout programming. Until now, most of its content lived inside its own app or on connected fitness hardware. With Samsungâ€™s integration, that expertise becomes available to millions of people witâ€¦

title: Zakk Wylde Says Ozzy Osbourne Wanted to Record a â€˜Heavyâ€¦ Melodicâ€™ Album BeforeÂ Death
summary: The longtime Osbourne guitarist said Ozzy was in the mood to revisit their 1990s groove on the LP he was considering before his death in July at 76.
body: Ozzy Osbourne was hoping to record one more album before his shock death in July at age 76. According to the late hard rock icon’s longtime solo band guitarist, Zakk Wylde , not long after this summer’s all-star Back to the Beginning show honoring Black Sabbath and Ozzy’s solo career, the Prince of Darkness rang Wylde up with some ideas for a potential album. Related Oasis Bid Farewell to Australia: 'Thanks For Putting Up With Us' Ozzy Osbourne Was the No. 2 Artist on TouchTunes for Q3 of 2025 Yungblud Hits Back at â€˜Bitter & Jealousâ€™ Critics of Ozzy Osbourne Tribute at MTV VMAs â€œHe was texting me, â€˜Zakk, letâ€™s do another record. Because I really loved it when you were going through your Allman Brothers, Skynyrd phase when we did â€˜No More Tears,â€™ itâ€™s heavy but itâ€™s more melodic, itâ€™s not pummeling heavy,â€™â€ Wylde told N.J.com of the vibe Ozzy was in search of that would hearken back to their early 1990s salad days working together on albums including 1991’s No More Tears and 1995’s Ozzmosis . â€œSo I said, â€˜Alright Oz, whatever you want.â€™â€ Ozzy took the stage to perform his solo hits and a handful of Sabbath classics at the July 5â€¦

title: Foo Fighters Announce Dates For 2026 Take Cover European StadiumÂ Tour
summary: The run of shows slated to kick off on June 10 in Oslo will feature opening sets from Royel Otis, Inhaler, Idles and others.
body: The Foo Fighters will warm up for their planned run of summer 2026 North American stadium shows with a run of U.K. and European stadium gigs. The Foos’ Take Cover European tour is slated to kick off on June 10 at Oslo, Norway’s Unity Arena. The run of 12 shows will include stops in Stockholm, Warsaw, Munich, Paris, Liverpool, Berlin, Vienna and Milan, before winding down with appearances at the Mad Cool Festival in Madrid, Spain on July 8 and the NOS Alive Festival in Oeiras, Portugal on July 10. Support on the dates will be provided by Royel Otis, Inhaler, IDLES, Otoboke Beaver, Die Spitz and Fat Dog. The general on-sale for the dates will kick off on Friday (Nov. 14) at 10 a.m. local time; click here for more ticketing information. The Foos have been gearing up for a return next year via a series of underplay club shows â€” including last month’s “ Cage Match ” show for Amazon Music Live â€” and the release last month of the hard-hitting new single, “ Asking For a Friend .” The upcoming shows will be the first large-venue gigs with new drummer Ilan Rubin, who left his spot in Nine Inch Nails earlier this year to join the Dave Grohl-led band;â€¦

title: We unboxed the OnePlus 15: Hereâ€™s everything inside

In classic OnePlus fashion, official teasers about the device have already been gushing in, confirming notable upgrades for the global variant, including its massive 7,300mAh battery â€” a 21% upgrade over the OnePlus 13. As OnePlus prepares to launch the OnePlus 15 globally, it has given us access to the device. While we work on a detailed review for you to see soon, weâ€™re bringing you a quick unboxing experience of the OnePlus 15. title: Jonas Brothers Will Ring in 2026 With New Yearâ€™s Eve Special FromÂ Florida
summary: The gig at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino is part of the trio's partnership with Samsung TV Plus.
body: The Jonas Brothers will ring in the new year in Florida after a 2025 run of shows celebrating their 20th anniversary as a group. Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas will take the stage at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino on Dec. 31 for a two-hour show slated to kick off at 10 p.m. ET that will be livestreamed exclusively on Samsung TV Plus. “Greetings from 2026 ğŸ©¶ We couldnâ€™t imagine closing out 2025 anywhere else but with you. Thank you for making this one of the most unforgettable years in our 20-year journey so far,” the group wrote in an Instagram post announcing the gig on Sunday night (Nov. 9). Tickets for the Greetings From 2026 gig will go on sale through an artist pre-sale beginning on Wednesday (Nov. 12) at 10 a.m. ET, followed by a public on-sale on Thursday (Nov. 13) at 10 a.m. ET. If you can’t make it down to the show, you can still watch the gig live on Samsung TV Plus. The show will feature a mix of early hits, fan favorites and songs from their most recent album, Greetings From Your Hometown . â€œ2025 will be a year we will always remember, and we couldnâ€™t think of a better way to kick off the new one than celebrating with our fans,â€ the group said in a stateâ€¦

The credit card may offer cashback, which can be redeemed against Samsung products, including phones. In addition to the card, Samsung is also said to be exploring financial products such as high-yield savings, digital prepaid accounts, and BNPL. One of the significant perks of owning an iPhone is that you walk into a seamless ecosystem of convenience. While many people feel suffocated by the walled garden, others appreciate how easy it makes their lives. For instance, iPhone users in the US can apply for an Apple Card, a credit card that is designed primarily for use with Apple Pay on Apple devices. Android doesnâ€™t have a competing product, but it seems that could soon be changing as Samsung is in talks to launch its own co-branded consumer credit card in the US. title: These 3 features made me drop Chrome for Samsungâ€™s new PC browser
summary: Not bad for a first go on desktop, Samsung.
body: When I installed Samsung Internet Beta for desktop earlier this week, I wasnâ€™t expecting much. The Korean company is an established browser builder on Android, but that doesnâ€™t mean its first desktop browser would be an immediate success. If anything, I was expecting a complete mess of AI fluff, unfocused design, and terrible performance. I couldnâ€™t have been more wrong. Based on Google Chrome â€™s underpinnings, Samsung Internet Beta is a breath of fresh air. Itâ€™s 2025, and the odd mandatory mention of AI features is present, but Samsung Internet isnâ€™t an â€œAI browserâ€ in the same vein as OpenAIâ€™s Atlas or Perplexityâ€™s Comet . It is far more traditional in its philosophy and offers excellent design decisions that improve upon Chromeâ€™s usability, privacy, and multitasking capabilities.

title: Baseusâ€™ latest Qi2.2 chargers are smaller, faster, and cheaper for Black Friday
summary: Next-gen charging meets Black Friday savings.
body: Credit: Baseus If youâ€™ve recently picked up an iPhone 17 or plan to soon, you might be due for an upgrade to your charger as well. Baseus is one of the biggest names in mobile accessories, and it recently launched its next-gen PicoGo series. As the holiday season rolls around, both devices are already discounted for Black Friday. These are among the first Qi2.2-certified products on the market, offering faster speeds, smarter magnetic alignment, and safer charging for iPhone and Android alike. Qi2.2 offers a max 25W charging speed, making wireless charging as fast as wired. iPhone 16 and 17 models already support it, while Android manufacturers like Google and Samsung are lining up to adopt the standard. For anyone who uses their phone as a work tool, camera, or travel companion, grabbing a compatible charger is a future-proofing move.

You can actually see the phoneâ€™s blue coolant circulating through the whole system. The RedMagic 11 Pro uses an unfreezable, server-grade fluorinated liquid and a piezoelectric micropump to move coolant through a loop. The REDMAGIC 11 Pro , Nubiaâ€™s brand-new gaming phone, is already one of the most eye-catching Android flagships right now. However, it turns out that the phoneâ€™s hidden liquid cooling system might just be its most jaw-dropping feature. In a new YouTube Short, JerryRigEverythingâ€™s Zack Nelson peeled back the rear cover of the phone to show whatâ€™s concealed underneath, and itâ€™s unlike anything weâ€™ve seen before.

title: 12 apps I urge non-techies to install on their Android phones
summary: Looking beyond preinstalled apps or the obvious choice can often yield a better user experience.
body: The Android apps that come preinstalled on a phone have several advantages. For one, theyâ€™re already there â€” you donâ€™t need to visit the Play Store and sift through numerous options to find one that might meet your needs. Secondly, theyâ€™re usually from the manufacturer itself, which means theyâ€™re tightly integrated into the broader framework of your phone. However, as is often the case in life, whatâ€™s easiest isnâ€™t always the best, and this is especially true for smartphone apps that non-tech-savvy users might employ. These users might benefit more from a more approachable or supportive product that you or they would need to install.

title: The Venu 4 upped its fitness tools and price tag, and itâ€™s still my favorite Garmin smartwatch
summary: The Venu line remains one of the best options for serious athletes who also want smartwatch aesthetics and features.

title: I almost ditched Chrome for Samsungâ€™s new PC browser, but one missing feature is stopping me
summary: I rely on custom search engines too much to use a browser that lacks them.
body: Chrome has been my default browser for a long time, but recently Iâ€™ve been looking into alternatives that offer useful new features that Googleâ€™s browser canâ€™t match. Thereâ€™s always one sticking point that leads me to go back to Chrome, and unfortunately, the same can be said for Samsung Internetâ€™s Windows release . It gets a lot right, but one missing feature is preventing it from becoming my main browser. Thereâ€™s a lot to like Credit: Zac Kew-Denniss / Android Authority The feature I love most in Samsung Internet is the split-view mode, along with the sidebar. Split-view puts two tabs side-by-side without having to open a new instance of the tab. The sidebar, as seen in the far right of the image, is a space where you can open a third page in a mobile UI. This has been great for researching and writing articles, as I can have my writing and two research tabs open all in one place without switching windows.

title: T-Mobile might still be the best postpaid carrier, but the bar is low
summary: Postpaid just isn't what it used to be, making prepaid more appealing than ever before.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority Thereâ€™s no sugar coating it, the cellular industry is a mess right now. Verizon is bleeding subscribers, T-Mobile has come under fire for betraying its un-carrier spirit, and AT&T is just downright forgettable at this stage. Unless youâ€™re locked into a legacy plan, itâ€™s really hard to recommend any of the big three anymore. Still, if I had to pick one option, it would be T-Mobile. But as much as I adore my e-ink notebook-library-in-one, thereâ€™s one thing the Scribe still doesnâ€™t get right, and thatâ€™s portability. My biggest pipe dream for the line is a foldable design. title: Android 16 fixes a big privacy flaw in its â€˜approximateâ€™ location setting
summary: Android 16 makes it harder for apps to infer the locations of rural users from their devicesâ€™ approximate locations.
body: Many Android apps ask for your current location to show you more relevant results or help with directions, but most donâ€™t need your precise GPS coordinates to do the job. Thatâ€™s why Android offers two levels of location accuracy: Precise and Approximate. These options are controlled by two different Android permissions and are intended for different kinds of apps. If an app requests a precise location, Android provides the most accurate estimate it can, usually within 3 to 50 meters (about 10 to 164 feet). If an app requests an approximate location, however, Android will only provide a rough estimate of your deviceâ€™s location, which may only be accurate to within 3 square kilometers (about 1.2 square miles). This is why navigation apps always require your deviceâ€™s precise location, while most other apps can function perfectly well with either.

title: YouTube Music uploads saved my rare songs â€” hereâ€™s how
summary: Preserving my music library, one upload at a time.
body: Music collecting and appreciation is a deeply personal hobby. Itâ€™s something very important to me and serves as a snapshot of time and place. Over the years, most of us of a certain vintage have built our music libraries piece by piece, from rare digital downloads and fan remixes to songs that never made it to streaming platforms. Even mixtapes if you, like me, are a 90s or earlier kid. For me, those tracks represent more than nostalgia. Theyâ€™re a record of growing up online, scouring file-sharing forums for one-off singles, MySpace, and now, an ever-growing collection of vinyl records collected during my travels. Every record I collect tells a story. A dusty Cuban jazz album I picked up in Havana, the Japanese city pop release I stumbled upon in a secondhand store in Shibuya, or the deep techno record from a small label in Berlin that went under decades ago. You catch my drift. These albums arenâ€™t just music albums, theyâ€™re memories. And yet, when I want to go back to any of them on the go, itâ€™s not an option. Way too many of them donâ€™t exist anywhere in the digital domain. Not on Spotify, not on Apple Music, and all too often, not even on YouTube.

title: Dear Google: I want my smart glasses to become my food logbook
summary: Because food tracking is still stuck in the manual age
body: I donâ€™t count myself as a fitness-tracking nerd who needs a smartwatch strapped to his wrist every waking second just to log every muscle twitch. I wear mine only while working out, or occasionally when Iâ€™m away from my phone for a bit â€” like when itâ€™s in another room â€” to avoid missing calls or notifications. Thatâ€™s it. Thatâ€™s the entire purpose of a smartwatch for me. While my watch can track everything from my broken sleep to biking laps â€” you know, the calories I burn â€” without me lifting a finger, it canâ€™t as seamlessly track the calories that go into me. Iâ€™ve always struggled with nutrition tracking. Even though dozens of apps let you log your daily meals, the friction remains. The only wearable that could bridge this wide gap in fitness tracking, I foresee, is smart glasses. And even though Iâ€™m not too fond of making every wearable â€œsmart,â€ if glasses could handle nutrition tracking for me, Iâ€™d happily throw my wallet at them.

title: Your bedtime scrolling habit might not be wrecking your sleep after all
summary: In big news for phone addicts, new research found no clear link between bedtime screen use and poor sleep in adults.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR A study found no clear link between bedtime phone use and poor sleep in adults. Both regular and occasional bedtime scrollers reported better sleep than moderate users. Researchers say age and how you use your phone may matter more than blue light itself. For years, weâ€™ve been warned to ditch our phones well before bedtime, with experts saying the blue light is likely to be detrimental to our sleep quality. Turns out, you might not have to feel so guilty about that final scroll after all. As reported by Gizmodo , a new study titled The Complex Association Between Bedtime Screen Use and Adult Sleep Health found no clear link between nightly screen use and poor sleep among adults. In fact, both occasional and regular bedtime screen users reported better overall sleep health than those who used their phones moderately.

Googleâ€™s Pixel Watch 4 appears to be significantly lacking in features compared to the Galaxy Watch 8 , particularly in terms of health-related metrics. These features are currently under trial with Fitbit Labs, and a small group of users can participate in testing them ahead of others. With an upcoming update, some Pixel Watch users may be able to highlight any concerning deviations in their vitals. title: LGâ€™s 3-in-1 MoodMate projector brings color, sound, and streaming to your living room

The LG MoodMate wants to be your big screen, mood light, and Bluetooth speaker all at once. It features a unique design that blurs the line between home theater and lifestyle gadget. Launched in South Korea, the MoodMate is a standing projector with a design LG says was inspired by floor lamps. It boasts a compact, portable unit capable of projecting images up to 120 inches at Full HD (1080p) with specs including 300 ANSI lumens of brightness and HDR support. body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority I recently compared ChatGPTâ€™s Sora 2 against Googleâ€™s Veo 3 AI video generator and came away impressed by how far OpenAI had pushed the boundaries of the technology with its realism and accurate physics. At the time, Sora 2 was only accessible via the web or a dedicated iOS app. Now, OpenAI has brought the Sora app to Android and itâ€™s more than just a basic AI video generator â€” itâ€™s a full social media platform similar to TikTok or YouTube Shorts that you can also personally star in. And while platforms like Midjourney have allowed you to share your AI creations with others, the new Sora app takes things one step further â€” it allows you to add your own face and voice to the video. So how does Sora achieve this bizarre feat and whatâ€™s it like to use? I installed it to find out.

title: SATELLAI Collar vs Halo Collar 4 vs SpotOn: Which GPS dog collar performs best?
summary: Which one delivers the best comfort, tracking, and peace of mind for you and your pup?
body: If youâ€™ve ever watched your dog take off toward an open gate or disappear behind a row of trees in your backyard, you know that sudden rush of panic. A good GPS dog collar can alleviate that worry while also serving as a valuable training tool. It gives your dog the freedom to explore while keeping them safe and giving you a little extra peace of mind at the same time. I spent the past few days using three of the leading GPS dog collars â€” the SATELLAI Collar , the Halo Collar 4, and the SpotOn GPS Fence â€” to see how they hold up in everyday life. From open fields and forest trails to backyard playtime, I wanted to know which collar felt easiest to live with, which one stayed connected, and which gave me the most useful information about my dogâ€™s activity and safety.

title: Google Messages will soon save you from opening web pages â€” hereâ€™s how Insights will work
summary: We've spotted the exact instructions that will be passed on to Gemini to generate Insights summary.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The upcoming â€œInsightsâ€ feature in Google Messages will use Gemini to provide a concise, three-point summary of shared links. The feature will be able to use both the provided link information and external web searches, and it will notify the user if it retrieves data from outside sources. Dual-SIM users will soon get a clearer interface, with the SIM carrier name returning to the compose box. When we previously spotted Google Messagesâ€™ upcoming Insights feature , there were barely any clues about its functionality. We presumed that Insights would provide a quick summary of the web page, and to that extent, our presumption is correct. title: Samsung should not release the Galaxy Z Fold 8 if itâ€™s missing these 2 features
summary: I fear Samsung's eye will be on the TriFold and it will adopt the laziest attitude for the Z Fold 8.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority During its quarterly earnings conference call last week , Samsung teased a bunch of changes, better chips, more AI innovation, and upgraded cameras to keep its shareholders happy. Among those pledges was a focus on how well the Galaxy Z Fold 7 has been doing in terms of sales and public reception, and a vague promise to keep innovating within the foldable lineup and â€œprovide new experiences.â€ Iâ€™m sure Samsung is subtly hinting at its upcoming Galaxy Z TriFold with its impressive tablet-and-phone design, but I do hope the allure of a hot new form factor doesnâ€™t let the Korean giant forget about its existing Fold line-up. The Galaxy Z Fold 7 has already impressed us, but it still needs two major upgrades next year, and I donâ€™t think Samsung should rest on its laurels or skip them.

title: Leakers just canâ€™t agree if the Galaxy S26 Ultraâ€™s cameras are an upgrade or a downgrade
summary: Making matters more confusing than ever.
body: TL;DR A noted leaker has contradicted a recent rumor about the Galaxy S26 Ultraâ€™s camera. According to Ice Universe, the Galaxy S26 Ultraâ€™s 3x telephoto will be downgraded â€” and not upgraded, as was recently suggested. They say these changes are made to accommodate the slimmer profile of the upcoming Samsung flagship. There are two cadres of Android flagships. In the first category, brands such as OnePlus work tirelessly to make each new phone appear radically different from its predecessor. In the other category, brands such as Samsung reiterate a proven formula and introduce a new phone with some internal changes and minimal cosmetic variations. In the case of the Galaxy S26, too, weâ€™re witnessing the same pattern repeated, where only minor optimization-oriented tweaks are, once again, expected to take priority over anything radical. That also holds for the camera we see on the Galaxy S26 Ultra, which is expected to undergo only minimal variations â€” or so we thought until yesterday, when a leak hinted at one of the four cameras being upgraded . That may turn out to be untrue, as reputed leaker Ice Universe has strongly opposed these leaks.

title: I tried to love Gemini Live ahead of its Google Home debut, but I canâ€™t imagine paying for it
summary: Google's Gemini Live is still not dependable, one year on.
body: Credit: Prakhar Khanna / Android Authority With Gemini slowly but finally rolling out to Googleâ€™s smart speakers and displays, Iâ€™ve found myself filled with renewed optimism for my stack of devices. The search giant has stripped the platform of countless features over the past couple of years, and even some basic voice commands have failed to function like they once did. Iâ€™m not alone â€” hundreds of users have voiced the same complaint about Google Home across social media. Luckily, Gemini looks like itâ€™s on track to revive Google Homeâ€™s usefulness but Iâ€™m equally concerned that it will introduce problems of its own. Given that I already have Googleâ€™s AI Pro subscription , Iâ€™m also looking forward to using Gemini Live â€” the two-way voice conversation feature that wonâ€™t require a wakeword every single time. However, after extensively using it on my phone, my excitement levels for the featureâ€™s expansion have been significantly dampened.

These features will only work in the deviceâ€™s default language, likely disappointing for multilingual users. title: Wordleâ€™s latest update adds a whole new way to play with your friends
summary: Bamboozle your smart-aleck buddies.
body: Credit: Matt Horne / Android Authority TL;DR The New York Times has added a â€œCreate Your Wordle Puzzleâ€ feature for Games subscribers. You can now design custom Wordles with your own word, screen name, and optional clue. Created puzzles can be shared via a link and played by anyone, including non-subscribers. Wordle has become part of many peopleâ€™s morning routine, including me and my dad, with whom I differ on tactics . But now thereâ€™s a new twist for those who fancy themselves as question masters. Instead of only solving the daily word, you can make them yourself. According to The New York Times , which acquired the game in 2022, it has added a new feature called Create Your Wordle Puzzle to its Games app on iOS or Android , or through the website. If youâ€™re an All Access or Games subscriber, youâ€™re able to design custom challenges using any four- to seven-letter word. You can then send it to your friends and family, who donâ€™t need to be NYT Games subscribers to play it.

Today, one of the earliest manufacturers of Find Hub trackers, Pebblebee, is selling a couple of new trackers that come with some interesting perks. Theyâ€™re both compatible with Googleâ€™s Find Hub as well as Apple Find My, and unlike many previous Pebblebee trackers, neither requires a proprietary charger. title: Thought you were in the clear on YouTube age verification? Think again
summary: YouTube's flagging a fresh wave of accounts to prove they're adults.
body: TL;DR YouTube shared its plan earlier this year to begin using AI to flag accounts that may not be in use by adults. Enforcement began over the summer, with flagged users asked to submit documentation verifying their ages. This week a new wave of accounts is being targeted, and users are once again upset. Whatâ€™s the most controversial thing Google has done so far in 2025? From AI ethics to antitrust issues, weâ€™ve got no shortage of topics to talk about there, but for YouTube viewers, one of the biggest has got to be the decision to start requiring users to provide proof that theyâ€™re adults . We finally saw that effort get underway a few months back, and now it looks like thereâ€™s another big wave of accounts getting flagged. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Appleâ€™s first foldable iPhone could be a major leap for under-display selfie cams
summary: JP Morgan reportedly expects it'll use a 24-megapixel sensor under its inner screen.
body: TL;DR The first folding iPhone could come with a 24-megapixel under-display selfie camera. Samsungâ€™s latest Z Fold 7 moved away from the under-display selfie cameras previous models used. Appleâ€™s first foldable could launch in the second half of 2026. Smartphone manufacturers tend to get ideas from each other. Once Samsung or Google or Apple proves an idea is technically viable and, more importantly, marketable, the other players often move to implement it in their own products. Following the success of folding phones from the likes of Samsung and OPPO, Apple is reportedly working on a foldable of its own. Weâ€™ve known that for a while, but now, weâ€™ve seen more evidence that suggests the first folding iPhone will use an under-display camera embedded in its internal display. We first heard that the foldable iPhone would feature an under-display camera by way of a May leak . Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Z Fold phones used similar technology through the Z Fold 6 until switching to a more conventional hole-punch design in the Z Fold 7. On balance, this was probably the right move â€” the Z Fold 6â€™s under-display camera used a four-megapixel sensor, making for a selfie camera that just wasnâ€™t very goâ€¦

title: Google Finance wants to become your smartest investing assistant with these new features

body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has added Deep Search to the new Google Finance experience, offering comprehensive answers via Gemini. Google Finance will also include prediction market data from Kalshi and Polymarket for future event analysis. These features are rolling out in the US, but the new experience is also expanding to the Indian market, offering support in both English and Hindi. Google added a new live earnings experience to Google Finance beta last week, bringing live audio streams, instant transcripts, and AI-powered summaries that explain the key takeaways from company results. The company isnâ€™t stopping there, as today, Google has announced that Google Finance is getting support for Deep Search and prediction markets, and the new Finance experience is expanding to a new market. title: Deal: Sous vide makes food delicious, and this cooker is on sale!
summary: You have no idea how much tastier your food will get.
body: Credit: Anova Have you heard of the sous vide cooking technique? My life changed completely after I started incorporating it into my daily cooking routine. It saves me time and makes my food much more delicious! That said, it can be a bit of a pricey endeavor, so itâ€™s nice to find good deals like todayâ€™s Anova Precision Cooker 3.0 sale. Itâ€™s discounted by $129.01! Buy the Anova Precision Cooker 3.0 for just $99.99 ($129.01 off)

title: Eater Wins Two International Association of Culinary Professionals Awards
summary: Last night, winners were announced at the 47th annual International Association of Culinary Professional (IACP) awards at the Venue at City Harvest in Brooklyn, New York. The IACP awards recognize excellence in four overarching categories: cookbooks, digital media, food writing, and food photographâ€¦

title: Google Messages doubles its pin limit, in case youâ€™re avoiding more than 10 people
summary: A small update for Google Messages, a big win for procrastinators.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google Messages now lets you have up to 20 pinned conversations, up from the previous limit of 10. The expanded limit appears to be rolling out in the latest version of the app. Pinning keeps important chats visible, but if youâ€™ve got 20 pinned, it might be time to reply to a few. Sometimes you get one of those texts that you donâ€™t want to reply to right away, but also donâ€™t want to forget about entirely as more messages arrive. Thatâ€™s where pinned conversations come in handy, keeping your most important threads at the top of your inbox so they donâ€™t get buried under new ones. Google Messages has long offered the pinned conversations feature, but now itâ€™s turning it up to 11 â€” or, more accurately, to 20. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: UGREEN Uno Charger 30W drops back to record-low price!
summary: This is my favorite charger, just because of its design!
body: Credit: UGREEN While often overlooked, I believe it is crucial to get a good experience out of a charger. After all, it is the tech gadget I use the most, after my smartphone. The UGREEN Uno Charger 30W is one of my favorite models, just because it is so fun, and itâ€™s also at a record-low price right now. Buy the UGREEN Uno Charger 30W for just $17.98 ($12.01 off)

title: Spotifyâ€™s new listening stats are here to tide you over until Wrapped season
summary: Now you can show off your taste in music every week.
body: TL;DR Spotify now offers shareable weekly listening stats. Listening stats highlight which artists and tracks youâ€™ve listened to the most each seven days. The feature is available beginning today for free and Premium users in many countries. Spotify Wrapped kicks off a flurry of social media activity every December as users share their year-end listening stats. Now, Spotifyâ€™s getting a new feature that offers a little bit of that experience on demand, whenever you want it. In a blog post this morning, Spotify announced that the app is getting a weekly listening stats feature. These weekly stats arenâ€™t delivered in as glossy a package as the once-a-year Wrapped, which comes with a slick multimedia slideshow. Instead, your listening stats highlight which artists and tracks youâ€™ve listened to the most in each seven-day period in a simpler, but still shareable, format.

title: T-Mobile will give you 4 lines and 4 phones for $25 per line, no trade-ins required
summary: You'll need to jump ship from AT&T or Verizon to get in on this one, though.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is offering four lines and four phones for $25 per line with no trade-ins required. The deal is only available to switchers coming from Verizon or AT&T. Customers can choose between a free iPhone 17 or Galaxy S25 on the entry-level Essentials plan. Recently, I released an article on what I thought were the five best T-Mobile deals available , but it turns out I missed one because it didnâ€™t exist yet. T-Mobile was saving its best offer for last it seems, as it has announced a few new holiday deals. Chief among these offers is a promotion that gives you four lines and four phones for $25 per line , all without any trade-ins required. This deal gives you the choice between an iPhone 17 or a Galaxy S25. You might be thinking that T-Mobile already offered these phones for free without a trade-in. Thatâ€™s true, but previously, you needed a higher-tier plan.

title: Niagara Launcher softens its minimalist core with new vivid themes
summary: And specially illustrated wallpapers that don't lose their essence to the app list.
body: Credit: Niagara Launcher TL;DR Niagara Launcher is receiving a new visual update, featuring a range of new themes and wallpapers. Unlike traditional minimalist wallpapers, Niagara is bringing several new intricately designed illustrations for wallpapers. The update also improves backup features and adds Bing as a search engine option. Niagara Launcher is one of the most distinct Android launchers , and its impact extends beyond its visual characteristics. Having used it for over two years, I can confirm that it alters â€” in a good way â€” how you approach the app drawer. I now install it on all the phones I review and strongly recommend it too. However, thereâ€™s one aspect that keeps me from feeling completely satisfied, which is the limitation of using wallpapers of my choice. The launcherâ€™s peculiar design for the app list makes it difficult to use visually rich wallpapers, but this issue may be getting addressed with a new update. In July, the developers of the launcher introduced a new theme playground , enabling users to experiment with various clock styles, wallpapers, and colors. Now, Niagara Launcher is getting another visual upgrade with a host of new themes, icon packs, wallâ€¦

title: I left my mirrorless camera at home for the fireworks and donâ€™t regret it
summary: Can my phone's camera really compete with my mirrorless when shooting in the dark?
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Bonfire Night in the UK presents budding photographers with a wealth of opportunities for capturing fun snaps. Usually, Iâ€™d take my Fuji mirrorless along to snap some neat pictures of our local bonfire and skies full of delightful fireworks. But this year, with two boundless toddlers to shepherd, I decided Iâ€™d probably need both hands free and would have to rely on my smartphone for quick snaps instead. On the plus side, Iâ€™d been looking for an excuse to test out the dedicated â€œFireworksâ€ mode in the OnePlus 13 and OPPO Find X8 Pro (Iâ€™m using the latter) camera apps. The mode seems to combine long and short exposures, providing vivid detail with well-exposed lighting and colors. Given that I probably wouldnâ€™t have time to optimize shutter speed and ISO while keeping an eye on the little ones, this mode would do all the heavy lifting for me.

title: AYANEOâ€™s first affordable flagship will remain the best deal in gaming handhelds for two more weeks
summary: This is your last chance to save $60 on one of the best retro gaming handhelds you can buy.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR AYANEO has moved pre-sales of the KONKR Pocket FIT to its website after a successful crowdfunding campaign. Super early bird pricing will remain for two weeks, with shipping expected to start in mid-December for the G3 Gen 3 model. The Snapdragon 8 Elite model will go up for pre-sale on the website in a few weeks, as itâ€™s further from shipping. The Indiegogo campaign for the KONKR Pocket FIT was a smash success, raising nearly $1 million before it ended yesterday. Typically, these devices become much more difficult to recommend after the early bird deals end, but in this case, you have a little more time. AYANEO has announced that pre-sales for the KONKR Pocket FIT will continue via its official website . More importantly, the super early bird pricing, which was previously extended until the end of the Indiegogo campaign, has been extended for an additional two weeks.

title: OnePlus 15â€™s massive battery and fast charging are going global
summary: At 7,300mAh capacity, the OnePlus 15 sets the stage for multi-day battery life.
body: TL;DR The OnePlus 15 is set to launch globally on November 13, with specs matching those of the Chinese variant. Key confirmed features include a 7,300mAh battery, 120W wired charging, and 50W wireless charging. The phone will also feature multiple industry-leading durability ratings: IP66, IP68, IP69, and IP69K. The OnePlus 15 was launched in China last month and is set to launch globally on November 13 . Ahead of its official launch, OnePlus has confirmed key specifications that will make its way to the global market, specifically in the areas of battery and charging. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Galaxy S26 may bring these new camera features, even without major hardware upgrades
summary: By upgrading a lesser known app that supercharges the camera on any Galaxy flagship.
body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR The Galaxy S26 might receive notable camera upgrades, even without many changes to the hardware. Samsung is rumored to bring more features to Camera Assistant, an app that unlocks hidden Camera settings on Galaxy phones. Among other features, we could see the option to click pictures at 24MP by default instead of the existing 12MP or 50MP modes. Samsungâ€™s Galaxy S26 series appears to have kept Samsung busier than usual. While the lineup was slated to receive an overhaul with new product names, the changes were reportedly quashed recently, forcing Samsung to return to the older classification . And all this toiling may have contributed to a delayed launch and fewer upgrades to the Galaxy S26 series than we had hoped , especially in the camera department. While the camera itself isnâ€™t receiving any significant upgrades, some of the software features supporting it are expected to improve. One way we can see this improvement is by adding additional camera settings options to Samsung phones through a first-party extension.

title: Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 runs hot, and not all phones can handle it
summary: Hot chips, cold results: This new flagship proves powerful processors need cooling.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority I was reasonably impressed when benchmarking my first Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 handset . The Nubia REDMAGIC 11 Pro I tested performs within just a few percentage points of Qualcommâ€™s best-case reference model from its launch event, suggesting the new Snapdragon will retain the performance crown for another year. However, thereâ€™s one significant caveat â€” graphics stress tests hit blistering highs of 56Â°C to maintain peak performance over time. Thatâ€™s far too hot to hold the phone comfortably. The only reason the REDMAGIC didnâ€™t buckle under such extreme heat is its elaborate liquid cooling system and fan setup.

title: E-reader fans want to bring back the book look, ignoring what made Kindles great
summary: I'm not heartless, but nostalgia shouldnâ€™t dictate design.
body: Thereâ€™s a wave of e-reader innovation on the rise, but one specific direction baffles me: dual-screened e-readers that fold like a paperback. While the prospect of having an e-reader that emulates the original two-fold book design seems fun, I absolutely loathe the idea of having two halves by choice, necessitating that I either use two hands or flex my fingers across the hinged gutter. The book-shaped comeback no one asked for

title: Iâ€™ve used a hundred phone cases and Iâ€™d never recommend the official Pixel 10 case
summary: Lint today, slipperiness tomorrow, long-term durability problems â€” this isn't a case worth $50.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Since the early 2010s and my HTC Desire Z, Iâ€™ve bought and used over a hundred different phone cases, with various materials and designs, all ranging from the cheapest to the super expensive. Iâ€™ve had thin hard shells, bulky Otterbox armors, flip-case leather, faux-leather, aramide fiber, TPU, slimy and transparent, colorful and rigid â€” you name it. Recently, every year or two, Iâ€™ve also tried Googleâ€™s official case for my Pixel phones just to see if it was worth using, and every time I did, it started well and ended in disappointment. I didnâ€™t learn my lesson. I just bought the official Pixelsnap case for my Pixel 10 Pro XL (), and although thereâ€™s a lot to love here, I wouldnâ€™t recommend it to anyone. Hereâ€™s why.
